title.narrative: Xinjiang Akesu Integrated Urban Development and Environment Improvement Project

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to improve the urban environment and promote inclusive economic development of Akesu City, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region (XUAR), the People's Republic of China (PRC). It is a multisectoral and integrated urban upgrading project that will address urgent environmental and infrastructure needs, including the (i) rehabilitation of the Akesu Duolang Wetlands; (ii) upgrading of urban infrastructure and services, including roads, public parks, water supply, sewerage, and district heating; and (iii) strengthening the institutional capacity for sustainable urban development, planning, and management of Akesu Municipal Government (AMG).

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
87.0% of people in the project area have improved access to district heating (compared to 12.7%)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: 100.0% of people in the project area have their solid waste collected (compared with 18.7%)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: 88.6% of people in the project area have improved access to sewerage (compared to 8.0%)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: Number of days meeting class II national ambient air quality standards increased above baseline (232)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: Number of traffic accidents involving personal injury reduced from baseline (286)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.

title.narrative: The value of ecosystem services (flood retention, irrigation, sediment and nutrient removal, biodiversity habitat, and groundwater replenishment) in Akesu Duolang wetlands increased above baseline ($1.12 million)

description.narrative: Quality of municipal services and environment improved.
